DataElement.preferredName: Trail Making Test Second Part Discontinue Reason Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field to as related to neurocognitive evaluation of Trail Making Test Part B being stopped or ended, permanently or temporarily.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Trail Making Test Second Part Discontinue Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function._Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude._One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.

Concepts.definition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.
